title: Channel Islands National Park: 2015 Archived Lecture Videos
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Multimedia Presentations     From Shore to Sea Lectures     2015 Archived Lecture Videos                  2015 "From Shore to Sea" Archived Lecture Videos      Please note that there are only six lectures in the 2015 series: March, April, May, September, October, and November.             Keeping Up with Ocean Change: pH Variability at the Channel Islands   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:53 minutes, 16 seconds  Marine Biologist Lydia Kapsenberg will discussed her research project monitoring ocean acidification at Channel Islands National Park during the March From Shore to Sea lecture.               Marine Protected Areas - Ten Year Assessment   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 3 seconds  The positive effects on sea life observed at the Channel Islands after ten years of protection through marine protected areas was discussed by Dr. Jennifer Caselle during the April From Shore to Sea lecture.               Seal and Sea Lion Population Trends at the Channel Islands   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 4 minutes, 49 seconds  Population changes of seal and sea lion species at the Channel Islands, including the recent high abandonment rate of California sea lion pups, was discussed by marine biologist Dr. Brent Stewart during the May From Shore to Sea lecture.               Discoveries of Chumash Use of Santa Cruz Island   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 1 minute, 58 seconds  Dr. Jennifer Perry discussed recent findings about the settlement of the interior regions of Santa Cruz Island by the Island Chumash during the September From Shore to Sea lecture.               Droughts to Floods: Weather and Climate in Southern California and Potential Impact of El Nino   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 2 minutes, 8 seconds  National Weather Service Meteorologist Eric Boldt discussed current El Niño predictions and provided drought and wildfire updates during the October From Shore to Sea lecture.               Exploration of Chumash Indian Plant Knowledge and Usage   Loading the player...       Visit JWPlayer docs for keyboard shortcuts  Duration:1 hour, 18 minutes, 10 seconds  Dr. Jan Timbrook discussed the relationship between the Chumash people of the Santa Barbara region and the native plants they used for food, medicine, tools, and other essential items during the October From Shore to Sea lecture.
